page.title: 01Coastline South of Gairloch
page.content: Landscape: Rocky coastline, with two sandy bays N. & S. of Redpoint. Inland the undulating Moor rises to 180m in East. People: Redpoint is a very small community at the end of the road.There are no shops. Visitors come to enjoy the sandy bays and the views across to the Isle of Skye. Redpoint Farm is pastural, mainly sheep, a few cows and goats. Several young people are trying to make it pay but it is very light sandy soil and very isolated. The men have other jobs (eg Forestry Commision) and work the farm in their spare time. SE of Red Point on the edge of Loch Torridon is an abandoned fishing station. It is only used as a store for fishermens gear now, or as a shelter for hikers on their way to the youth hostel further south.
